gov.usgs.anss.util

Class Distaz

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.Distaz

  • public class Distaz
extends java.lang.Object
    The author if theses routines is la rgely unknown, though I think H. Benz did the original. D.Ketchum changed them to allow user supplied arrays to be used rather than creating them and made all of these routines static as I could see no good reason to create an array each time something was called.

      static void computeLatLon(double olat, double olon, double dist, double azimuth, double[] answer)

    • Method Detail

      • distaz2

        public static double[] distaz2(double lt1,
               double lg1,
               double lt2,
               double lg2)
        Calculate the distance az and back az from two lats and longs. Differs from distaz() as it System.exit() if error occurs rather than reporting it and then returning a bad answer. It always creates the results array rather than using a user supplied one, so distaz() is preferred.
        Parameters:
        lt1 - First latitude
        lg1 - First Longitude
        lt2 - 2nd latitude
        lg2 - 2nd longitude
        Returns:
        array of 4 with dist(km), dist(deg), az, and baz

      • distaz

        public static double[] distaz(double lt1,
              double lg1,
              double lt2,
              double lg2)
        Calculate the distance az and back az from two lats and longs. Differs from distaz2(). This reports an error and returns bad distances if something odd happens
        Parameters:
        lt1 - First latitude
        lg1 - First Longitude
        lt2 - 2nd latitude
        lg2 - 2nd longitude
        Returns:
        array of 4 with dist(km), dist(deg), az, and baz

      • distaz

        public static double[] distaz(double lt1,
              double lg1,
              double lt2,
              double lg2,
              double[] results)
        Calculate the distance az and back az from two lats and longs. Differs from distaz2(). This reports an error and returns bad distances if something odd happens
        Parameters:
        lt1 - First latitude
        lg1 - First Longitude
        lt2 - 2nd latitude
        lg2 - 2nd longitude
        results - Must be at least 4 long returned with dist(km), dist(deg), az, and baz
        Returns:
        the users array with 4 values that is results

      • computeLatLon

        public static void computeLatLon(double olat,
                 double olon,
                 double dist,
                 double azimuth,
                 double[] answer)
        DCK - I moved this from a similar named Java file of Harley's and modified it to be static and return answers in an array
        Parameters:
        olat - latitude to project from
        olon - Longitude to project from
        dist - Distance in km
        azimuth - Azimuth from latitude and longitude measured clockwise from North in degrees
        answer - latitude in index 0 and longitude in index 1, user must create a double array of at least dimension 2

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
